course.subject: COMP
course.name: Database Architecture and Implementation
course.description: Introduction to the relational model and SQL.  System architectures and implementation techniques of database management systems: disk and memory management, access methods, implementation of relational operators, query processing and optimization, transaction management and recovery.  Hands on experience with building the components of a small DBMS.

reviews.author: Andong
reviews.title: Nice instructor.
reviews.comment_content:
Basically follows the classic DB textbook "Database System Concepts". The contents covered were quite UG-level (SQL, relational model, query optimization, join algorithms, transactions, and concurrent control...)

2/3 of the semester were course lectures and 1/3 were student presentations. Only contents in lectures were examed. No attendance requirement.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dimitris is good at explaining things in a clear way.
Apart from his teaching, he is quite nice. He tries his best to accommodate all your (reasonable) requests on presentation and survey submission arrangements.
reviews.comment_grading:
Have no idea with the final grading scheme, but I think it is fair. My final exam score ranked around top 25%, and I got A-.

The exam questions were standard, which covered all aspects I mentioned and focused on basic concepts and approaches.
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignment or project. One survey (around 3000 words required) and one presentation (less than 15min) in a DB-related research area. One final exam.

P.S. Dimitris's advice on the survey and presentation:  "Independently of your topic, focus on the general problem and methodologies. Try to avoid technical details and complicated math"
